result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alexandria Marie Simon

records.addlTxt: Signed and filed: Scheduling Order for Jury Trial Dated 2-6-23
Received and Filed: Proposed Scheduling Order for Jury Trial Dated 2-6-23

Defendant Alexandria Marie Simon in court.  Attorney William Hotchkiss in court for Alexandria Marie Simon.  Attorney Amanda Kirklewski in court on behalf of Attorney James Griffin for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a status conference.  Defense requests final pre-trial and jury trial dates.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Pre-trial Scheduling Order signed and filed by the Court.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Final pre-trial scheduled for January 6, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for February 6, 2023 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Alexandria Marie Simon in court.  Attorney William Hotchkiss in court for Alexandria Marie Simon.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a calendar call.  Defendant appears in court via Zoom.  Court vacates stayed warrant.  Parties request trial dates in January 2023.  However, Court has not yet received jury trial dates in 2023. 
 Court schedules a status conference.  Court advises defendant that all court appearances are required.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Status conference scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney William Hotchkiss in court.  Amanda Korin Kirklewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Case scheduled for status conference.  Defendant failing to appear.  Defense counsel requests that the Court impose and stay a warrant.  State has no objection. Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until next court date.  Calendar call scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Alexandria Marie Simon in court with attorney William Hotchkiss.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 via Zoom.  Status conference scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Alexandria Marie Simon in court with Attorney William Hotchkiss.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer D. Meyer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Alexandria Marie Simon in court by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared  in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with MES.

Defendant Alexandria Marie Simon in court with attorney William Hotchkiss.  Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 2.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 4/13/22 @ 1:30p
